div.div: NEWTON COUNTY NEWS

div.style: margin-top: -0.5em; font-size: 1.1em; font-family: Montserrat; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

br.div: Stay Up-to-Date on the Latest News

div.class: inner col col24 first last idab1def6a-4593-4889-b284-f5a3d8ecd410

div.div: Newton County Juvenile Court Judge Sheri Capes Roberts announced her retirement Wednesday, effective May 1, 2020. Read more ...

h4.a: Primary Election to be postponed until June 9

div.div: Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger announced the postponement of the Statewide General Primary/Presidential Preference Primary Election until June 9. Read more ...

h4.a: Governor Kemp extends statewide Shelter in Place Order to April 30

div.div: The order is effective from Friday, April 3 at 6 p.m. through Monday, April 30 at 11:50 p.m. for the entire state. Read more ...

h4.a: Kemp, Duncan, Ralston Announce Plans to Extend Public Health State of Emergency

div.div: Georgia State of Emergency to extend to May 13, 2020. Read more ...

h4.a: Now accepting new building permit applications

div.div: Newton County will begin accepting new Building Permit Applications online and via mail/courier April 6. Read more ...

h4.a: What does Shelter in Place mean?

div.div: The intent of Newton County’s Shelter in Place ordinance is to ensure that the maximum number of people self-isolate in their place of residence to slow the spread of COVID-19 to the maximum extent possible. Read more ...
See a list of department changes in the Newton County government due to COVID-19 response. Read more ...

img.alt: Image of Newton County Animal Control

div.div: Newton County Animal Services is taking measures to mitigate the short- and long-term effects of COVID-19 by following recommendations set forth by the National Animal Care and Control Association. Read more ...
Due to caution for COVID-19 voting has been postponed to May 19. Read more ...

h4.a: All Newton County Recreation Youth Athletics Cancelled

div.div: NCRC has cancelled its Easter Egg Hunt at Wolverine Field on April 4, Spring Break Basketball Camp at Turner Lake on April 6-10 and Spring Break Wildlife Camp at Turner Lake on April 6-10. Read more ...

img.alt: Image of Convenience center map reduction

h4.a: Convenience Center hang tags to be $75 starting March 1

div.div: The 2019-20 vehicle hang tags for the Newton County Trash Collection Convenience Centers will be reduced to $75 on March 1. The FY 2020 Tags expire June 30. Read more ...

img.alt: Image of Government 101 chalk for news

h4.a: Join us for Newton County Government 101

div.div: New Government 101 classes will teach you all about every aspect of Newton County's Government. Learn about each office and department and ask questions to the County's leadership. Read more ...
/CivicAlerts.aspx

h4.a: Newton County Government 101 is new educational program

div.div: The Newton County Government 101 allows Newton County residents a chance to learn about their local government. Read on...

h4.a: Department of Public Health Coronavirus health advisory

div.div: “DPH is working to make sure our health systems, first responders and county health departments have the resources they need to respond to a COVID-19 outbreak.” - Kathleen E. Toomey, M.D., M.P.H., DPH Commissioner. Read more ...

img.alt: Image of Newton County Family Fun Day 2020

h4.a: Family Fun Day will be April 25

div.div: The Newton County Family Fun Day returns to Legion Field, in celebration of #OneNewton, on Saturday April 25, from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. Read more ...

img.alt: Old Brick house with wood steps in front

div.div: File an online complaint with the Code Enforcement Department. You can remain anonymous while detailing your issue. Additional Info...

img.alt: Image of Newton County Animal Control

div.div: Newton County Animal Control is collecting donations to directly help animals in our shelter. Additional Info...

img.alt: Image of Convenience Center in use

div.div: Newton County offers trash collection convenience centers to its residents in the form of 6 collection centers. Additional Info...
Home meal delivery is available for all qualified seniors who are 60 and older and live in Newton County. Additional Info...
